meanings.definition: The state of being worn or showing signs of wear.
meanings.sent1: The old chair's wornness was evident in its creaks and cracks.
meanings.sent2: The shoes' wornness indicated they had been well-loved and used.
meanings.sent3: The wornness of the teddy bear made it look like a wise old friend.
meanings.sent4: The wornness of the path through the forest told stories of many travelers.
meanings.sent5: The wornness of the book's pages showed it had been read countless times.

meanings.definition: The quality of being tired or exhausted.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, his wornness was visible in his slow steps.
meanings.sent2: Her wornness after the busy day was clear from her heavy eyelids.
meanings.sent3: The wornness in his voice made it clear he needed a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent4: The wornness in her smile showed she had been through a lot that day.
meanings.sent5: The wornness in his posture revealed the fatigue he felt after the long journey.

meanings.definition: The act of using something until it is no longer in good condition.
meanings.sent1: The wornness of the tools in the shed meant it was time for replacements.
meanings.sent2: The wornness of the rope was a sign it had been used extensively.
meanings.sent3: The wornness of the pencil showed it had been a favorite for sketching.
meanings.sent4: The wornness of the car's tires indicated they needed changing soon.
meanings.sent5: The wornness of the blanket was a testament to its years of warmth and comfort.
